p: Finally, the climatic range encompassed by the sampled populations and test sites for Pinus sylvestris and by the test sites for Picea abies (particularly for rainfall for Picea abies), being smaller than covered by the natural distributions of these species, may have limited our capacity to model the response function for the species as a whole with sufficient robustness. However, even with this limitation, we were able to capture the pattern of genetic differentiation between populations, with the detection of very pronounced clines for P. sylvestris, as shown in Fig. 5.
